snippet: The Senate Intelligence Committee has asked the C.I.A. for an internal study that lawmakers believe is broadly critical of the C.I.A.’s detention and interrogation program.
abstract: Senate Intelligence Committee asks Central Intelligence Agency for an internal study that lawmakers believe is broadly critical of CIA's detention and interrogation program but was withheld from congressional oversight committees; request comes during yearlong battle with CIA over release of panel’s own exhaustive and highly critical report about the program, one of the most controversial policies of the post-September 11 era.
lead_paragraph: The Senate Intelligence Committee has asked the C.I.A. for an internal study that lawmakers believe is broadly critical of the C.I.A.’s detention and interrogation program.

headline.main: Senate Asks C.I.A. to Share Its Report on Interrogations
headline.print_headline: Senate Asks C.I.A. to Share Study on Detentions
